image.altText: Two workers on the side of a steep mountain picking coca leaves off coca plants

items.synopsis: Follow the path cocaine takes from Colombian bush labs to your local suburbs — and the battle to intercept it.

title.children: Cocaine is everywhere in Australia. Here's why

image.altText: Yevgeny Prigozhin shakes hands with someone and smiles as he leaves the headquarters of the Southern Military District in a car

items.synopsis: The boss of the Wagner mercenaries has aborted his bid to topple Russia's military leaders. Here's what we know about the deal brokered with Yevgeny Prigozhin and what the fallout from the mutiny might mean for Vladimir Putin.

title.children: What happened during the Wagner Group mutiny — and what comes next? Here's what we know

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: Troubled consultancy firm PwC Australia confirms it will sell off its government business as it tries to stem the fallout from a massive tax leak scandal.

title.children: PwC appoints new CEO and announces it will sell off government business for $1

image.altText: Woman wearing a patterned blue dress and red glasses smiles, with her hands together. Tropical trees are in the background.

items.synopsis: As international students struggle to find accommodation, more Australians than ever before are renting out their spare bedrooms — and it's helping pay the bills.

title.children: 'If you've got a spare bedroom, you can turn it into tax-free income': More Australians hosting international students

image.altText: A woman in a parliamentary committee, yelling across the room

items.synopsis: It's been a busy two weeks in Northern Territory parliament, with ministers and their departments coming under scrutiny. Here are the key takeaways.

title.children: Shouting, laughing and questions over integrity: The key moments from NT estimates

image.altText: A finger touches the Facebook app on a smartphone

items.synopsis: Online platforms spreading misinformation and disinformation could face millions of dollars in penalties under new proposed federal government legislation that bolsters the power of Australia's media watchdog.

title.children: Millions of dollars in fines to punish online misinformation under new draft bill

image.altText: A dam surrounded by grass with trees in the background

items.synopsis: Severe weather continues in South Australia today, with the State Emergency Service issuing watch and act messages for two dams at high risk of failure at Basket Range and Hope Forest.

title.children: Warnings for two dams at high risk of failure, as severe weather continues across South Australia

image.altText: OceanGate Titan submersible floating at the surface of the ocean

items.synopsis: The Transportation Safety Board of Canada says it is conducting an investigation into the loss of the Titan submersible and has been speaking with those who travelled on Canadian-flagged mothership, the Polar Prince.

title.children: Canada investigating why the Titanic-bound submersible imploded

image.altText: An orca moves along a rudder of the a team competing in a Spanish boat race.

items.synopsis: A pod of killer whales bumps one of the boats in an endurance sailing race as it approaches the Strait of Gibraltar, prompting anxiety over patterns of apparently aggressive behaviour.

title.children: Orcas surround and nudge racing yacht off Spanish coast

image.altText: A closeup headshot of Julian Sands looking at the camera with messy hair and a black jacket and white collar

items.synopsis: Hikers find remains of a human body in a Southern Californian mountain area where British-born actor Julian Sands went missing in January, having set off on his own hike in the region east of Los Angeles.

title.children: Human remains found where actor Julian Sands disappeared five months ago

image.altText: Historical black and white photo of Kenmore House in Rockhampton.

items.synopsis: From plans to split the state of Queensland to gruesome murder tales and a global fortune. Home-grown researchers strike historic gold under the floorboards of these heritage homes.

title.children: Hidden stories of Queensland homes uncover fascinating histories and gruesome murders

image.altText: Wagner mercenary fighters on top of a tank, with a Wagner flag.

items.synopsis: Wagner troops leave Rostov-on-Don and Yevgeny Prigozhin will move to Belarus under a deal brokered by Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko to end the mutiny.

title.children: Wagner Group retreating from Russia, leader Prigozhin to move to Belarus

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin gives a televised address.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin's decision to launch a full-scale war against Ukraine has backfired catastrophically, so much so that it may end up leading to his downfall, writes Steve Cannane.

title.children: Putin has never looked so vulnerable, and it's due to his own creations

image.altText: Young mastiff

items.synopsis: Queensland authorities want to get tough on owners of dangerous dogs with new laws that could see them jailed. The state could also become the first to completely ban some breeds.

title.children: Queensland could be the first state with a total ban on certain dog breeds

image.altText: A close of a  woman with her hand covering her face, a man peering on in background

items.synopsis: The annual Cockroach Cup has become an iconic race in the Pilbara city of Karratha — but there's a catch for the winner.

title.children: Welcome to the Cockroach Cup, where the winner gets eaten

image.altText: A man stands beside a broken-down vehicle with a big yellow sign on the side saying 'help' in black letters.

items.synopsis: Australia's stunning landscapes can be perilous for the unprepared. Two outdoor experts and an intrepid hiker give their tips for surviving in the alps, the outback and the tropics.

title.children: Why a 'MacGyver kit' could stop a camping emergency from becoming a tragedy

image.altText: Selfie of a man with short dark hair

items.synopsis: A court refuses Kirt Field bail after hearing the 37-year-old, who has been charged with more than 20 offences, is a flight risk.

title.children: Man appears in court over alleged kidnapping and domestic violence offences

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair, standing near a waterway smiling.

items.synopsis: Meningococcal B is a rare but deadly disease that is not covered by the National Immunisation Program. The parents of a young woman who died from it last year are trying to change that.

title.children: 'One death is too many' as parents of meningococcal victim issue vaccine plea for festivals and schoolies

image.altText: A swimmer in the ocean looks out at a large opening in a rock wall.

items.synopsis: Attracting more than a million visitors each year, the Kiama Blowhole is the biggest in the world but most only see it from the top. Ex-navy officer and ocean swimmer Scott Gutterson heads underneath to document what it's like inside the blowhole's chamber.

title.children: Inside Kiama Blowhole's secret underground chamber

image.altText: A group of children play in the red dirt as a sun sets behind them

items.synopsis: Aboriginal leaders in WA's north are calling for structural change with recent Closing the Gap data highlighting only four of 19 targets are on course to be met by 2031.

title.children: Closing the Gap failings are unacceptable for families and communities, Kimberley leaders say

image.altText: Nick Daicos pumps his fist in celebration

items.synopsis: Collingwood leave it late again, coming from behind in the last to beat Adelaide in a cracker at the MCG, while Gold Coast claim an important 67-point win over Gold Coast.

title.children: Stellar Daicos leads Pies to another last-quarter classic against Crows

image.altText: An NRL player is tackled during a trial game

items.synopsis: The Roosters host the Raiders at the Sydney Football Stadium. Earlier the Cowboys thrashed the Rabbitohs and the Titans celebrate a shock win over the Broncos. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: The Roosters take on the Raiders in Sydney after the Cowboys beat Souths and the Titans upset the Broncos

image.altText: Rainbow storytime supporters rallying outside the Thirroul library

items.synopsis: A community in the New South Wales Illawarra has turned out to voice support for a Rainbow Storytime event despite protests from far-right groups.

title.children: Residents rally in support of LGBTQI+ community amid right-wing protests at drag queen reading event

image.altText: A woman wearing a grey shirt looks directly to camera

items.synopsis: In the 12 months since the US Supreme Court overturned the law enshrining abortion rights nationwide, the landscape has drastically changed. Abortion is now prohibited or heavily restricted for millions of Americans, and providers are worried their most vulnerable patients will continue to suffer.

title.children: After Roe fell, Anya Cook ended up miscarrying her unviable pregnancy in a hair salon bathroom

image.altText: A young woman standing in the historical monument in Yogyakarta, capital city of the Central Java province.

items.synopsis: For these Australians, studying abroad opened their eyes to the colour and complexity of life in a close neighbouring country.

title.children: Maya had 'the best six months' of her life in Indonesia, but it wasn't in Bali

image.altText: A portrait of Mandy looking into the camera. Her van is behind her. The back is open. Many items are inside.

items.synopsis: The rise in homelessness is easy to see across Australia, with more rough sleepers on streets and tent cities in parks. But there's a group experiencing homelessness who prefer to go unnoticed — the growing number of people living in vehicles.

title.children: 'Van life' is glamorised on social media. Here's the reality for one woman whose car is now home

items.synopsis: An intense herd rebuild has left Australia with more cattle for market, and graziers and consumers alike are set to benefit.

title.children: Cheaper steaks on the way as more meat heads to market

image.altText: A bridge is collapsed over a river with items layered ontop each other in the river. It looks like a rural area.

items.synopsis: Officials shut down drinking water intakes downstream due to the "potential hazmat spill" while they evaluate the danger of the accident.

title.children: Freight train carrying hazardous materials plunges into Yellowstone River

image.altText: Woman wearing a patterned blue dress and red glasses smiles, with her hands together. Tropical trees are in the background.

items.synopsis: As international students struggle to find accommodation, more Australians than ever before are renting out their spare bedrooms — and it's helping pay the bills.

title.children: 'If you've got a spare bedroom, you can turn it into tax-free income': More Australians hosting international students

image.altText: A composite image of two Facebook ads, run by the Yes and No Voice campaigns.

items.synopsis: Both sides of the Voice to Parliament referendum campaign are starting to spend big on social media advertising, and where they’re directing their dollars gives us some clues about their strategies, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: The Voice No campaign has spied a path to victory, and it hangs on Australia's smallest states

image.altText: Four men, two boys, one woman, a girl stand in a paddock holding chickens, chickens flock behind them, all wear jackets.

items.synopsis: What does it take to homeschool five children? "Considerable hours" to get the work done and no "squabbling", says this family.

title.children: Jocelyn and Mike have homeschooled their five children for years. It is not easy, but 'worth it'
